Class DBSubscriberConnection

java.lang.Object
dbLogic.systemLogin.DBSubscriberConnection
All Implemented Interfaces:
ILoginDatabase
public class DBSubscriberConnection extends Object implements ILoginDatabase
The DBSubscriberConnection class provides the database access logic specifically for the Subscriber authentication flow.

  • Method Details

    • verifySubscriber

      public int verifySubscriber(long subID)
      Verifies a subscriber's identity and checks for authorized roles within the system.

      This method searches the subscriber table for a matching ID and ensures the user has one of the following valid statuses: 'subscriber', 'manager', or 'representative'. If a match is found, it retrieves the internal user ID.

      Specified by:
      verifySubscriber in interface ILoginDatabase
      Parameters:
      subID - The unique numeric identifier of the subscriber.
      Returns:
      The associated user_id if the subscriber is found and holds an authorized role; returns -1 if the ID is invalid, the status is unauthorized, or a database error occurs.

    • verifyStatus

      public String verifyStatus(int userId)
      Retrieves the specific status or role associated with a given user ID.

      This method searches the subscriber table for a record matching the provided user identifier. It is primarily used to identify whether a user is a regular subscriber, a manager, or a representative.

      Parameters:
      userId - The unique internal identifier of the user to be verified.
      Returns:
      A String representing the user's status (e.g., 'subscriber', 'manager', 'representative') if a matching record is found; returns null if no status is found or if a database error occurs.

    • verifyOccasional

      public int verifyOccasional(String username, String contactInfo)
      Verifies the identity of an occasional customer (guest) in the system.

      Note: This specific implementation does not support guest/occasional customer verification. It acts as a placeholder or a restricted connector and consistently returns a failure code.

      Specified by:
      verifyOccasional in interface ILoginDatabase
      Parameters:
      username - The unique username provided by the occasional customer.
      contactInfo - The contact information (phone or email) provided by the customer.
      Returns:
      Always returns -1 to indicate that verification is not supported by this connector.

    • registerOccasional

      public boolean registerOccasional(String username, String phone, String email)
      Attempts to register a new occasional customer (guest) in the system.

      Note: This specific implementation does not support guest registration. It serves as a placeholder or a restricted version of the registration logic and consistently returns false to indicate failure.

      Specified by:
      registerOccasional in interface ILoginDatabase
      Parameters:
      username - The desired username for the occasional customer.
      phone - The customer's phone number.
      email - The customer's email address.
      Returns:
      Always returns false to indicate that registration is not supported in this specific connector.
